description: End users may experience unauthorized access and control over system functions due to the Windows USB Video Class system driver vulnerability (CVE-2024-43637). This issue could lead to an unauthorized user gaining system privileges, significantly compromising the integrity and confidentiality of system resources. Products affected include Windows Server 2025 and Windows 10 in various builds such as 10.0.26100.2314 and 10.0.19045.5131, as noted in KB articles KB-5046696, KB-5046633, and others. Users might notice anomalous system behavior following the application of the security updates due to improperly handled USB device interactions, which could appear as unexpected access requests or persistent prompts for administrative permissions.
